{{also|garten|Gärten}} ==German== ===Etymology=== {{PIE root|de|gʰerdʰ}} From {{inh|de|gmh|garte}}, from {{inh|de|goh|garto}}, from {{inh|de|gem-pro|*gardô}}, alternative form of {{m|gem-pro|*gardaz}}. Cognate with {{cog|nl|gaarde}}, {{cog|en|yard}}, and through a Romance borrowing from Frankish: {{cog|en|garden}}, {{cog|fr|jardin}}, {{cog|it|giardino}}. ===Pronunciation=== * {{IPA|de|/ˈɡaʁ.tən/|[ˈɡaʁ.tən]|[ˈɡaɐ̯.-]|[ˈɡaː.-]|[-tn̩]}} * {{a|Austria}} {{audio|de|De-at-Garten.ogg}} * {{audio|de|De-Garten.ogg}} ===Noun=== {{de-noun|m|Gartens|Gärten|Gärtchen|dim2=Gärtlein}} # [[garden]], [[yard]] {{gloss|grounds at the front or back of a house}} #: {{ux|de|Wir sitzen im '''Garten'''.|t=We're sitting in the '''garden'''.|inline=1}} # garden {{gloss|outdoor area containing one or more types of plants, usually plants grown for food or ornamental purposes}} # [[orchard]] {{gloss|garden or an area of land for the cultivation of fruit or nut trees}} ====Declension====
